Dave Astels  wrote:

>--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Manuel Amago" <mamago@b...> wrote:
>  
>
>>>>** Replies from J. B. Rainsberger are unwelcome
>>>>        
>>>>
>>>Am I the only person who considers this really, really rude?
>>>
>>>      
>>>
>>You are not alone!
>>
>>Not only do I find it *extremely* rude
>>    
>>
>
>Yes, it's incredibly rude.  I chose to just ignore that and answer it.
>Most of the People Who Know on here would give a pretty similar 
>answer anyway (which includes J.B.)
>  
>

I'm responsible for letting this message through.  I approved it.  Being 
a moderator is always a little tricky.  If I err, it's on the side of 
not censoring enough.  In this case, I had been traveling and behind on 
reading the list, so I didn't have a history of recent postings.  I also 
figured that any responses would be similar to a response from J.B., and 
I wanted the original poster (and this list) to experience that.  As 
such, I chose not to censor it and rather let it run its course.  In 
hindsight, here's the response I should have made earlier...

I'd highly recommend that everyone listen to what J.B. has to say here. 
 His advice comes from practical experience and far exceeds the amount 
you pay for it.  If you don't want replies from him, then I suggest you 
either don't post questions here or learn to ignore his replies.  In any 
event, be prepared for a response because he's here to help like 
everyone else.  If you don't agree with something he says, then I'd 
encourage you to challenge him in a professional manner.  

I, for one, consider this community very fortunate to have J.B. as a 
volunteer.  Indeed, I place a high value on his insights and 
contributions.  My actions as a moderator in this case should in no way 
be taken as a reflection of my opinions of J.B.  My sincere apologies 
for any confusion this may have caused.       

In the meantime, I'm putting myself on notice...

Mike
